thread.title: ESPN shuffles several games to put LSU on its main channel
thread.title_full: ESPN shuffles several games to put LSU on its main channel

title: ESPN shuffles several games to put LSU on its main channel
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest ESPN shuffles several games to put LSU on its main channel ESPN shuffled its lineup of games this weekend, giving the LSU game with South Carolina its prime spot at 2:30 pm on its main channel. Post to Facebook ESPN shuffles several games to put LSU on its main channel ESPN shuffled its lineup of games this weekend, giving the LSU game with South Carolina its prime spot at 2:30 pm on its main channel.  //on.wwltv.com/1RvYrmV   ESPN shuffles several games to put LSU on its main channel WWLTV.com 10:38 a.m. CDT October 8, 2015 Sep 12, 2015; Starkville, MS, USA; LSU Tigers running back Leonard Fournette (7) runs the ball during the second half of the game against the Mississippi State Bulldogs at Davis Wade Stadium. LSU won 21-19. Mandatory Credit: Matt Bush-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Matt Bush, Matt Bush-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW ORLEANS - ESPN shuffled its lineup of games this weekend, giving the LSU game with South Carolina its prime spot at 2:30 pm on its main channel, while pushing some games to lesser-seen channels. Other games, including Tulane's game at Temple, actually got bumped to more prime viewing channels. LSU - S. Carolina ticket, parking and donation information 
The LSU - So. Carolina game was originally scheduled for an 11 am slot on ESPN, and the network, no doubt, did not want to lose its chance to showcase Heisman favorite Leonard Fournette. 
The biggest casualty was the Minnesota at Purdue game, originally slated for the main ESPN channel. That game will now be seen on ESPNU.
